intro: Colliguaja patagonica, commonly known as the Patagonian cactus, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of southern South America. It belongs to the family Cactaceae and is characterized by its spiny stems and clusters of small, yellowish flowers. The plant is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments with minimal water availability. Its structure includes modified leaves that function as spines, reducing water loss and deterring herbivores. Colliguaja patagonica plays a role in local ecosystems by providing shelter and food for various desert animals.
